verses.plain: Then answered Zophar the Naamathite, and said,

tokens.t: Then answered Zophar the Naamathite, and said,

verses.plain: Therefore do my thoughts cause me to answer, and for this I make haste.

tokens.t: Therefore do my thoughts cause me to answer, and for
I make haste.

verses.plain: I have heard the check of my reproach, and the spirit of my understanding causeth me to answer.

tokens.t: I have heard the check of my reproach, and the spirit of my understanding causeth me to answer.

verses.plain: Knowest thou not this of old, since man was placed upon earth,

tokens.t: Knowest thou
this of old, since man was placed upon earth,

verses.plain: That the triumphing of the wicked is short, and the joy of the hypocrite but for a moment?

tokens.t: That the triumphing of the wicked
short, and the joy of the hypocrite
for a moment?

verses.plain: Though his excellency mount up to the heavens, and his head reach unto the clouds;

tokens.t: Though his excellency mount up to the heavens, and his head reach unto the clouds;

verses.plain: Yet he shall perish for ever like his own dung: they which have seen him shall say, Where is he?

tokens.t: he shall perish for ever like his own dung: they which have seen him shall say, Where
he?

verses.plain: He shall fly away as a dream, and shall not be found: yea, he shall be chased away as a vision of the night.

tokens.t: He shall fly away as a dream, and shall not be found: yea, he shall be chased away as a vision of the night.

verses.plain: The eye also which saw him shall see him no more; neither shall his place any more behold him.

tokens.t: The eye also
saw him shall
no more; neither shall his place any more behold him.

verses.plain: His children shall seek to please the poor, and his hands shall restore their goods.

tokens.t: His children shall seek to please the poor, and his hands shall restore their goods.

verses.plain: His bones are full of the sin of his youth, which shall lie down with him in the dust.

tokens.t: His bones are full
of his youth, which shall lie down with him in the dust.

verses.plain: Though wickedness be sweet in his mouth, though he hide it under his tongue;

tokens.t: Though wickedness be sweet in his mouth,
he hide it under his tongue;

verses.plain: Though he spare it, and forsake it not; but keep it still within his mouth:

tokens.t: he spare it, and forsake it not; but keep it still within his mouth:

verses.plain: Yet his meat in his bowels is turned, it is the gall of asps within him.

tokens.t: his meat in his bowels is turned,
the gall of asps within him.

verses.plain: He hath swallowed down riches, and he shall vomit them up again: God shall cast them out of his belly.

tokens.t: He hath swallowed down riches, and he shall vomit them up again: God shall cast them out of his belly.

verses.plain: He shall suck the poison of asps: the viper’s tongue shall slay him.

tokens.t: He shall suck the poison of asps: the viper’s tongue shall slay him.

verses.plain: He shall not see the rivers, the floods, the brooks of honey and butter.

tokens.t: He shall not see the rivers, the floods, the brooks of honey and butter.

verses.plain: That which he laboured for shall he restore, and shall not swallow it down: according to his substance shall the restitution be, and he shall not rejoice therein.

tokens.t: That which he laboured for shall he restore, and shall not swallow
down: according to
substance
the restitution
, and he shall not rejoice

verses.plain: Because he hath oppressed and hath forsaken the poor; because he hath violently taken away an house which he builded not;

tokens.t: Because he hath oppressed
hath forsaken the poor;
he hath violently taken away an house which he builded not;

verses.plain: Surely he shall not feel quietness in his belly, he shall not save of that which he desired.

tokens.t: Surely he shall not feel quietness in his belly, he shall not save of that which he desired.

verses.plain: There shall none of his meat be left; therefore shall no man look for his goods.

tokens.t: There shall none of his meat be left; therefore shall no man look for his goods.

verses.plain: In the fulness of his sufficiency he shall be in straits: every hand of the wicked shall come upon him.

tokens.t: In the fulness of his sufficiency he shall be in straits: every hand of the wicked shall come upon him.

verses.plain: When he is about to fill his belly, God shall cast the fury of his wrath upon him, and shall rain it upon him while he is eating.

tokens.t: he is about to fill his belly,
shall cast the fury of his wrath upon him, and shall rain
upon him while he is eating.

verses.plain: He shall flee from the iron weapon, and the bow of steel shall strike him through.

tokens.t: He shall flee from the iron weapon,
the bow of steel shall strike him through.

verses.plain: It is drawn, and cometh out of the body; yea, the glittering sword cometh out of his gall: terrors are upon him.

tokens.t: It is drawn, and cometh out of the body; yea, the glittering sword cometh out of his gall: terrors
upon him.

verses.plain: All darkness shall be hid in his secret places: a fire not blown shall consume him; it shall go ill with him that is left in his tabernacle.

tokens.t: All darkness
hid in his secret places: a fire not blown shall consume him; it shall go ill with him that is left in his tabernacle.

verses.plain: The heaven shall reveal his iniquity; and the earth shall rise up against him.

tokens.t: The heaven shall reveal his iniquity; and the earth shall rise up against him.

verses.plain: The increase of his house shall depart, and his goods shall flow away in the day of his wrath.

tokens.t: The increase of his house shall depart,
shall flow away in the day of his wrath.

verses.plain: This is the portion of a wicked man from God, and the heritage appointed unto him by God.

tokens.t: This
the portion of a wicked man from God, and the heritage appointed unto him by God.

footnotes.text: I make…: Heb. my haste is in me
His children…: or, The poor shall oppress his children
within…: Heb. in the midst of his palate
his…: Heb. the substance of his exchange
none…: or, be none left for his meat
appointed…: Heb. of his decree from God
